name: remould
content:
remould verb [T]
(CHANGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to completely change the character of someone or something: He needs to remould his image if he wants to be elected leader. The invaders want to remould the region and its politics.
to make a soft substance have a new shape: The chef remoulded the mashed potato into the shape of a dinosaur. Plastic surgeons have remoulded the singer's neck and nose.
More examplesFewer examplesThe architect started work to remould the villa and its gardens.She has remoulded the traditions of French cooking.We were on a mission to remould society.
